column4: Hmmm, when i type "sudo iptables-save > /etc/iptables.test.rules" i get "bash: /etc/iptables.test.rules: Permission denied"
with that command, iptables-save gets run as root, but the file operation happens as your normal user
how would i log in as root?
the easiest way to get a root shell is "sudo -s", and type your password
